function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI systems assuming all contingencies are the same as those in the training dataset, leading to inaccurate decision-making","Impact":"Inaccurate decision-making can hinder efforts to contain contagious diseases and worsen public health outcomes","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough testing and validation of AI models using diverse datasets that represent a wide range of possible contingencies","Technologies":"Diverse dataset collection and validation techniques for AI models","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, and individuals at risk of exposure to contagious diseases","Owner":"Data scientists, AI researchers, and technology developers"},{"Description":"Privacy concerns associated with the use of AI for crowd surveillance, leading to fear and distrust among the public","Impact":"Fear and distrust hinder public cooperation with pandemic management efforts and may lead to social unrest","Mitigation":"Implement transparent and accountable governance frameworks for the use of AI in public health surveillance, and provide clear communication about the purpose and limitations of AI surveillance","Technologies":"Privacy-preserving AI algorithms, transparent governance frameworks for AI surveillance","People":"General public, individuals under surveillance, public health authorities","Owner":"Government agencies, public health authorities, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Dependence of AI on human knowledge and expertise for effective implementation in pandemic management","Impact":"Inadequate human expertise can hinder the use of AI in making informed decisions and interventions for pandemic management","Mitigation":"Invest in interdisciplinary collaboration between AI researchers and domain experts in public health, and develop AI systems that can autonomously adapt and learn from new information","Technologies":"Interdisciplinary collaboration platforms, autonomous learning AI systems","People":"AI researchers, public health domain experts, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, universities, and public health organizations"}]}
